page.title: 09SUPERNATURAL LEGENDS
page.content: FLORA In Maidstone Museum hangs a painting by Baxter of his beautiful daughter, called "Flora, The Gypsy Girl". A visitor named Frederick Saunders experienced a strange sadness or depression culminating in tears and a strong wish to flee the room. He never forgot the experience and painting and, finally, located the room again in 1940. The same emotion returned when he stood in a certain spot, looking at the painting. It is thought that she wants people who fully appreciate art and beauty to feel the sadness that someone so beautiful and young should die. It is the conscious part of her mind that lives on to haunt.
